title: Option Types
intro: This tab manages different types of DHCP options like IPs, URLs, and custom hosts.

items.name: Public
items.description: Routable IPs allocated externally. Often used in ISP or DMZ segments.

items.name: Multicast
items.description: Supports address distribution for multicast groups (224.0.0.0/4).

items.name: SuperScope
items.description: Groups multiple scopes for logical or overlapping network management.

items.name: Reserved
items.description: IP addresses manually mapped to specific MAC addresses.

items.name: Loopback
items.description: 127.0.0.1 range. Typically excluded from DHCP but may be reported.

items.name: DHCPv6
items.description: IPv6 stateful scope for client address assignment.

items.name: Link-Local
items.description: Self-assigned addresses in 169.254.0.0/16. Often excluded from scopes.

items.name: Failover Scope
items.description: Used in high-availability DHCP server pair configurations.

items.name: Excluded Ranges
items.description: IPs within a scope that should never be leased.

items.name: Relay
items.description: Used when DHCP is relayed across subnets or routers.

items.name: Guest
items.description: Temporary or isolated client networks with limited access.

items.name: Infrastructure
items.description: Scopes for switches, routers, APs, and other backbone devices.

items.name: VoIP Phones
items.description: Reserved for IP phones with specific QoS/lease requirements.

items.name: IoT Devices
items.description: Used for smart devices, typically segregated for security.

items.name: Lab/Test
items.description: DHCP scopes for test networks and staging environments.
